Sure, here are 10 more actionable ideas from the same article:

1. Identity graphs are based on the concept of a unified customer view, which is a single, comprehensive view of all customer-related data.
2. Building an identity graph requires a data integration strategy that allows organizations to bring together data from different sources.
3. Identity graphs are often built using graph theory, which enables organizations to represent complex relationships between data points.
4. Data scientists and data engineers can work together to build and maintain identity graphs, with data scientists focusing on the algorithmic aspects and data engineers focusing on the technical implementation.
5. The process of building an identity graph involves data cleansing, deduplication, and normalization to ensure that the graph is accurate and reliable.
6. Identity graphs can be used to connect data points from various sources, including social media, customer support interactions, and website interactions.
7. Identity graphs can be used to create customer segments based on shared characteristics and behaviors, which can be used to personalize marketing campaigns.
8. Identity graphs can be used to identify potential fraudsters by analyzing patterns of behavior across multiple data sources.
9. Identity graphs can be used to improve customer engagement and retention by providing personalized recommendations and promotions.
10. Identity graphs can be used to create a 360-degree view of the customer, which can help organizations understand customer needs and preferences and improve overall customer satisfaction.
